fields.description: Type of employment: government, private, self
The estimate for how many people in the US this person is representative of
What they do for a living
Relationship description of their marital status
Race (uses 1994 racial categories which excludes a number of distinctions)
Gender (uses 1994 Census options, which are binary)
Their reported capital gains for the year (these are monetary gains from things like selling stock instead of income from a job)
Their reported capital losses (for example, if they sold a stock that lost them money)
Their income: binary for greater than or less than $50,000

card.description: Data from the 1994 US census, with income, personal, and job data. Used to predict whether a person's income is over $50,000

context.potential_uses: Predict whether a person's income is over or under $50,000, based on their education level and age. Demonstrate racial and gender-based income inequality.
context.potential_misuses: Using this for something like determining whether or not to give someone a loan could be deeply unfair.
